description: No difficulties on openSUSE.
What do you think of the app? Try to give reasons for your views.

This is from an outside source explaining some things to try and resolve peoples' issues.
1. The Raspberry Pi 4 & 400.
These systems cannot run Minecraft's launcher by default, as the software has too many inconsistencies with the workarounds used. Don't hate on the outsourced one when neither of them work.
2. This isn't from Mojang.
Don't send hate or suggestions to these guys; they didn't make the game and as such do not have the proper licensing or permissions to change it. Send suggestions to Mojang; they made the game. They're just publishing it to other mirror locations so that people can get it.
3. Minecraft is a paid game.
Don't expect to get Minecraft data with this package. This is the launcher, which merely connects to Mojang, authenticates, and installs Minecraft. It does NOT come pre-configured with any additional data.

Thanks, that's all from me. The Minecraft website is at https://www.minecraft.net/ and if this package doesn't work you'll probably find something that'll work there.
Don't send hate towards people who can't change the game.
Note: Shockingly enough you actually need to BUY the game to play it ( besides the demo)
This is the Minecraft launcher, May or may not be official but it's on Linux stores anyway. Plus this person actually updates the launcher with the newest version.

description: This is an amazing game- but it doesnt launch on pi4
It does not work on raspberry pi 4. If you  want to to play cheap consider buying a hackboard 2. It is a SBC like the pi 4 but it is only 180$ au and runs windows and has a intel core.
continuous crashes

I'm thinking this would work really well on any other platform that is amd/x86/x64 based, but on an amd64 system like the raspberry pi 4 it doesn't load at all, "cannot execute binary file: Exec format error"  I suspect this is due to the latest minecraft launcher isn't a java program at all, but a compiled binary made for amd64 architecture. So not really the fault of the package maintainers, BUT if this doesn't work in a raspberry pi 4/amd64 system it shouldn't be available to install on those systems.
summary: Love minecraft, but no go on raspberry pi 4
